entry.et: Middle English borwen, from Old English borgian; akin to Old English beorgan to preserve bury

def.dt: :to receive with the implied or expressed intention of returning the same or an equivalent borrow a book borrowed a dollar
:to borrow (money) with the intention of returning the same plus interest
:to appropriate for one's own use borrow a metaphor
:to take (one) from a digit of the minuend in arithmetical subtraction in order to add as 10 to the digit holding the next lower place
:to adopt into one language from another
:to do something unnecessarily that may result in adverse reaction or repercussions
:an excavated area where material has been dug for use as fill at another location
